Numerical Linear Algebra

These are some notes I wrote while studying for my final exam on numerial linear algebra. Most are short summaries of some subjects we covered.

Part 1: Review of linear algebra:

  1. Vector spaces and subspaces
  2. Generator sets, linear independence
  3. Basis and dimension of a vector space
  4. Inner product, norm and induced norm
  5. Orthogonality and Gram-Schimdt method
  6. Linear transformations
  7. Kernel, Image and the dimension theorem
  8. Matrix of a linear transformation and isomorphism
  9. Eigenvalues and eigenvectors
  10. Review and TODO

Part 2: Systems of linear equations - Direct methods

  1. Gaussian elimination
  2. LU decomposition
  3. LU via Crout, Doolitle and Cholesky algorithms
  4. Partial and complete pitoving for LU decomposition
  5. Other matrix decompositions

Part 3: Special systems and problems that give raise to them

  1. Band, block and sparse matrices
  2. Some problems that give rise to these systems

Part 4: Iterative methods

  1. Jacobi and Gauss Seidel methods
  2. Convergence of Jacobi and Gauss Seidel methods
  3. Succesive Over Relaxation method (SOR)
  4. Gradient method
  5. Conjugate gradient method

Part 5: Eigenvalue and Eigenvector problem

  1. Intro and localization of eigenvalues
  2. Power method
  3. Inverse power method

Part 6: Some other transformations

  1. QR via Householder matrices
  2. QR via Givens matrices
  3. Hessenberg reduction

Part 7: TODO
